name: LOGIE-COLDSTONE-SCHOOL-2
comments: I have had a gauge placed at Blelesh three-quarters of
a mile from the position of the one I use, and that distance further
from the neighbouring hills. My object was twofold :—1st, to ascertain
the influence of neighbouring hills on the rainfall of a district; and
2nd, the local nature of summer rainfall. The observations of one
summer may not be of much value; but, so far as they go, they bring
out the fact that the vicinity of hills increases the rainfall. The
increase was most noticeable in the months of April, May, June, and
July. In August, the partial and local nature of summer showers
was very marked : while in the course of an afternoon, 2.4 in. fell here
at three-quarters of a mile distant .12 inches was the whole amount
